intro: Spigelia polystachya, commonly known as the clustered flame flower, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Spigelia polystachya is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
